page.title: 10HOME LIFE
page.content: FOR FOUR GENERATIONS A FARM IN THIS AREA HAS BEEN OWNED AND WORKED BY THE SAME FAMILY. APART FROM CONTRACTORS FOR SHEEP SHEARING, A BROTHER AND SISTER WITH ONE HIRED HAND FARM THE 542 ACRES. DUCKS, GEESE, TURKEYS, HENS AND GUINEA FOWL ARE FREE RANGE.FREE RANGE EGGS ARE FOR SALE AND BIRDS ARE BRED FOR SALE AND FOR FAMILY TABLE. BREEDING COWS ARE SOLD THROUGHOUT THE YEAR BUT A JERSEY COW IS KEPT FOR ITS HIGH QUALITY MILK FROM WHICH BUTTER AND CHEESE ARE MADE FOR HOME CONSUMPTION. A PIG IS KEPT FOR HOME CURED HAM AND BACON. ALL VEGETABLES ARE GROWN IN THE KITCHEN GARDEN AND GARDEN FLOWERS FLOURISH.BALING OF HAY RATHER THAN SILEAGE IS USED FOR ANIMAL WINTER FODDER AND TRACTORS ARE USED FOR WORKING THE FARM.THE LADY PLAYS THE ORGAN IN CHURCH AND ENJOYS WHIST DRIVES AND OLD TYME DANCING.
